website_summaries.verdict: A mid-level trimming tool by the brand that is also a good value. It has all you need – including battery and charger – to start manicuring your yard right out of the box.
pros: Has an adjustable cut path from 10 to 13 inches to fit a numerous trimming needs
Offers power to trim medium to large yards
Flower guard does a good job protecting delicate plants
Fairly lightweight and long battery life
cons: Owners may occasionally run into issues with the automatic line advance working as it should

customer_reviews.title: Worst replacement cartridge ever!
customer_reviews.text: Because the replacement cartridge is do difficult to use , I am throwing the entire trimmer away. This was a huge mistake to buy. I do not recommend this product because of the cartridge. The entire spool sprung apart as soon as I began to unclip the strings to thread. I have spent half an hour trying to re-wind the string and thread into the two holes. It just unwinds again and again. I am done. I have several of your products and love them. This was a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Poleke

customer_reviews.title: A great, quiet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cordless weed eater together with the Greenworks Twinforce lawn mower. The trimmer is lightweight and will not make your back feel crooked after a while. It also has guiding wheels for vertical operation, say at the sideline of a lawn. It does not need a lot of electricity, so the battery (even if you use the small 20 V one) hold the charge very long. The string will adjust automatically, so there's no hitting the ground all the time to extend the string, as with the older trimmers. A great, quiet, and powerful weed eater without the nuisance of an electrical cord.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoguyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worlds only 5” trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only tool I’ve ever purchased from Greenworks that I haven’t loved. 40v Chain saws, pole saws, lawn mowers, edgers, the works, all have worked amazingly. This trimmer however is an absolute pass, as the “automatic feed” makes it completely worthless. Manually feed out 3-4” of line, start the trimmer up, trim a few feet and the string is down to about 1.25”, and it stays there. The feed line is *never* more than 1.25” or so which means it’s got an effective trim width of about 5”. Talk about making edging a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Greenwing

customer_reviews.title: I took a picture of it today. 19 July 2017
customer_reviews.text: I want a refund or a replacement. It worked fine the first time, the second time it began to smoke & melt. I hope it was a fluke. I hope the seller contacts me to replace it with one that works. I would be happy to return it for a new one or a refund. No refund, replacement or contact as of 21 July 2017 Bad Business.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A Watson

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this weedeater last summer. Used roughly 5 times for 30 minutes each. Pull it out after storing it indoors all winter to use it. Worked for 15 minutes and then just shut off. Will not power on at this point. Have tried multiple extension cords, outlets, etc. No go. Its dead. So, couple the short life span with a "printer ink" style scheme to make you buy the Greenwork replacement string, and I put it firmly in the do not buy camp, unless you are looking for a short term, basically disposable weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Auto feed just doesn't work as advertised and line's too short
customer_reviews.text: Auto feed just doesn't work as advertised. The string line is too short. Probably about 2.5 inches. I often find myself stop the trimmer and have to manually keep pulling the line so that it is long enough then go on with the cutting. A trimming work that usually takes 10mn becomes a 30mn one. I would not recommend this trimmer. It is sad that I have to try a string trimmer from another brand because I already own a few 4Ah batteries and excellent greenwork tools like mower, saw, hedge trimmer, blower.
customer_reviews.author: java

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: After having good experiences with other products from this company, I was disappointed with how this string trimmer performed. The trimmer is difficult and tiring to use because of the way the shield blocks the view of where I am cutting, forcing me to hold it in an uncomfortable and tiring position. But the final straw was the way it stopped feeding the string even though the spool was still half full. Even after replacing the half full spool with a full one, the new spool would not feed either. Attempts to call the company for help were fruitless as I was always placed on hold. So now I am have a hardly new tool that is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Holland

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of greenworks. I have several of there lawn Care items but this one is so bad I finally tossed it in the trash today. The auto line feed never worked on it an now I can't even feed the line by hand. All the plastic parts on it are warn out and the head and handle flop around. Have not had it 2 years and it's junk now. I am not saying don't buy greenworks just think twice about this one. Just ordered there 14" brushless model hope it dose better.
customer_reviews.author: scott t

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job, but designed to be used by a strong man!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5' 4" female weighing 105 pounds and found that the string trimmer did a fantastic job, but I had a hard time controlling and maneuvering it due to its weight and center of gravity. I believe this problem could easily be solved by including some sort of a shoulder harness for us lightweights. I would have given this trimmer 5 stars, but the fact that using the trimmer for only five minutes wore me out, prevented me from doing so. Unit is obviously designed for a 6' 275 pound male! Guess I'll have to hire someone to do the trimming around my flower beds!
customer_reviews.author: MA Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle and won't feed the line well.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes of being able to use this to weedeat and as an edger. The line does not advance well at all. I have to stop and keep taking it off and pulling it out manually. Also I am having a very difficult time using this as an edger. Its just not strong enough to cut through a thick line of grass. I am just using it on previously edged grass that is not that over grown either. I'm very dissapointed that I didn't get a cordless product that could edge as well as a electric edger with a cord. I hope to see if I can return this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Attn: Updated Review - Received Reply from Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: Having previously complained that the auto-feed does not work, I received a response from Greenworks. They said the line automatically feeds about 1/4" each time the trimmer is turned on. I tried it and it does work - not every time. There is also a small hard-to-spot release button on the spool housing that allows line to be pulled out manually instead of having to pop the cover off to do it. Greenworks should start putting an instruction sticker right on the trimmer housing - obviously a lot of folks have this problem. And instruction manuals have become so cumbersome who reads them any more?
customer_reviews.author: S Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great... buuut...
customer_reviews.text: I really love this weed eater. I thought that it would go with the greenworks battery which I already have their set of drill and driver, (and love!) but this one plugs into a cord. Which is totally fine, the connection is secure. There’s a pit fall to this tho, the placement of the cord holder is right under the button you push to engage it. So if you have it looped under there it can push the button on without you actually pushing it. It’s a safety hazard, so do be careful with it. Otherwise this bad boy is a steal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jen OY

customer_reviews.title: Really great product and design with one significant flaws
customer_reviews.text: I’m pleased with nearly everything about this trimmer with one exception, and it’s kind of a big deal, the continuous feed design is sketch. It seems like a great idea. I read the reviews, I was on board with this “new“ technology but it doesn’t seem to work out as well as reported. I end up fiddling with the Line for way more than I should have to and the misfeeds are very frustrating. everything else decent product but for that reason alone I probably wouldn’t recommend buying one that’s not a bump feed.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Just a so so product.
customer_reviews.text: I read others reciew before buy this one. I compared it with the black and decker i have. I have to say this is a little to heavy for one, not so okay for its purpose. It doesn't clean very well as the b n d...i am a little disappointed. I only used it three times now. hopefully next time i can figure out what went wrong.
customer_reviews.author: justinlammmmm

customer_reviews.title: They both work great and with one battery we can mow and edge ...
customer_reviews.text: Rubber on battery makes it impossible to remove. We've owned the mower and weedwacker for about 6 months. They both work great and with one battery we can mow and edge our medium size yard. Removing the battery from this product is extremely difficult, there's a black rubber edging around the battery to protect it from being dropped which is nice but to bulky and makes removing for my wife impossible and very difficult for myself. In the mower it slides right out. At such a steep price the design should be universally easy. I'm considering getting the hedge trimmer but if I'll have the same issue if rather buy a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Mars Maltase

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Only worked once then wouldn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: As of now...HORRIBLE. I used this right after buying it. Went to use it about 3 weeks later and it doesn’t work. Not a battery issue because the battery works in the lawn mower. I was 6 days past the return date. As of now I have to talk with the manufacturer. I knew it was incredibly cheap when I got it because the handle was all lopsided and had to be taken apart and messed with to even get it to hook to the handle. I should have just returned it then.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McCready

customer_reviews.title: Auto feed...not even close.  Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this item. I was so excited to receive, as the gmax turbo lawn mower is so impressive. I gave the lawn mower 5 stars, as it's really incredible. This trimmer, however is not worth the hassle. It does not auto feed as described. If you follow instructions and start/stop to feed additional line, the line actually retracts, then disappears. This requires you to stop every few minutes, turn the machine over, take the spool off, pull line out, and start again. It's horrible. Do not buy, unless you are prepared to deal with this hassle. For me, it's goIng in the trash, and I will try the newer models.
customer_reviews.author: JGST

customer_reviews.title: Good weed eater for the money, just make sure you have an extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Likes - Better than the model I had a couple of years ago. A little more power, more ergonomic. Easier to extend the trimming cords. There is a loop near the handle to help stabilize the cord, so it doesn't pop out - nice feature. Dislikes - The handle you hold to steady the weed eater is plastic and not engineered in a stable manner. It will wobble on you. This is minor, but a flaw that should've been addressed by the engineers. The handle operates as an on switch. This is a bit too large of a switch and can accidentally be triggered when handling the device. I would've preferred this to be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Darin R. Swan

customer_reviews.title: For The Price It Does a Decent Job
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how it will work, but the price was right. I use it about once every other month for about 10-30 minutes. It does the job and has not failed so far. It is very light weight compared to a gas powered one. It has plenty of power for my needs. I use it for removing weeds growing on the edge of artificial grass and spots where weeds grow around my driveway. The weeds are relatively small with a diameter of probably no more than 1/4 inch. Not sure how it would do for large weeds and more dense weeds, but I am happy with this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: MDN

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Well you get what you pay for. I bought this based on the price as I did not need a fancy weed eater. However, the spool refuses to feed as advertised. No matter what I do (including following directions) the spool will not feed and when I manually pull the string out it last about 10 seconds. Piece of trash ... don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schrider

customer_reviews.title: nice whacker
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, works great with the 4AH battery I had for my saw. Honestly, I have done my whole yard twice and the battery is still above 30%. My only complaint is the line feed system is a little fiddly, I would prefer a bump feed set up. On this guy when the line gets too short you have to stop, remove a little snap on cap and feed out the proper amount of line by hand. Other than that and it is a little wonky on the balance side it is a great little machine so far. I never thought I'd go cordless electric but this guy flat works.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES MCKENNA

customer_reviews.title: Quite Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't really expecting too much since this only cost $22 and change. I am very impressed. I have only used it once so reliability will still be a question, but for a $22 weed wacker it was great. Very powerful. Relatively lightweight and the automatic string feed option worked perfectly. That is the one thing that always seems to fail on these automatic feed trimmers. It even came with an extra pre-wound string spool and an extra string headcover. I have paid three times this amount for a weed trimmer and never got an extra spool of pre-wound string. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: SEEJAYKAY

customer_reviews.title: Good Power/Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer and 40V blower expecting the 40V batteries to last longer than the 20V B&D tools I was replacing. Although the 40V battery provided great power to theses tools, they only lasted about 20-25 minutes when fully charged. Not what I was expecting at the price I was paying but I am happy with the quality and functionality of my Greewworks yard tools. I just purchased the 8 foot extending 8.5 inch chain saw and hope to get the same great quality from this too. I do recommend the Greenworks products but don't expect the batteries to last as long as they say. I still give them 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jpaquin31

customer_reviews.title: This product beats Ryobi hands down
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ryobi edger that battery life doesnt even edge the front sidewalk without dying! This greenworks product is awesome! The weedeater is a bit long and I am 5'8", but it is easy to maneuver and I love the on off feature to extend the string instead of the bump. bump feeds always got tangled. Easy to use and great battery life and I am a 59 year old woman that does all her own yard work! The battery lasts through all the weedeating front and back and then I switch it to the blower that I also purchased and the blower lasts on the same battery until the yard is done!! Great product! HIghly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 4 years and it works great. I bought this one for my girl friend and it also works great. Fairly light and easy to maneuver. The battery charges very fast. The only thing I would say is the battery is a little tough to remove. The service guys were great and sent me a replacement for my original unit immediately because of this issue. I actually scrapped away some of the inside plastic housing on the original unit and the battery is easier to get out. I still have it as a spare and the unit itself still works really well.
customer_reviews.author: vasimo

customer_reviews.title: Good first impressions!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is well built & balanced w/ the 4.0 Ahr battery. Our yard is mostly residential but one side is still wild forest. It worked well on the high grass but as I close to the brush & blackberry vines it bogged down. The trimmer head is very adjustable which helped on slopes & roadside ditches. Construction is pretty good & once you have the Greenworks battery the other tools are inexpensive to buy. I have yet to run the battery down by doing all the yard trimming. Seems to be a good product system & half the price of what you buy at the big box store.
customer_reviews.author: J. Savoie

customer_reviews.title: Overall great light weight weed whacker with minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really like all aspects of the string trimmer except for the quality control. The plastic case where the battery slides into place has been extremely tight since I bought the trimmer and now I'm going to have to take a rasp to shave off some of the plastic because the battery will no longer slide into place. I have two other Greenworks items and this is the only one that has this problem. Otherwise I've used the trimmer for years and while it's a little less powerful than some of the gas powered trimmers I've used it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Pigott

customer_reviews.title: My husband laughed
customer_reviews.text: When my husband had some health issues, it fell to me to do yard work. I couldn't stand gas fumes or the weight of his weed eater so I ordered this for me. He watched me put it together when it arrived and cautioned me to remember how it was packed so everything would fit when I returned it for lack of performance. He's 74 and I'm 69. I love this machine. As far as I'm concerned it can run with the big dogs. Hubby has been amazed at the tall grassy and weedy corners of the yard I can trim. He doesn't laugh anymore. ;)
customer_reviews.author: pamedian

customer_reviews.title: unbalanced, un-ergonomic and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: It works... ok. That's about all its got going for it. It has got to be the most unbalanced in-ergonomic trimmer ive ever had the displeasure of holding in my hands. Did I mention its heavier then my gas line trimmer? To get more line out you are required to push a hard to reach button. Forget about it if you have gloves on.... and it only has one string so guess what - youll b pushing that button often. I absolutely hate this thing. Id give it away for free if it didn't mean losing a battery for my other greenworx products. Yuge thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Love greenworks
customer_reviews.text: Okay so this is awesome I love how it’s a two in one weed wacker and trimmer! It’s super light weight and easy to use! We already have the lead blower so it’s super convenient that we only had to buy the tool and could use the same battery on both tools! The battery lasted pretty long an didn’t die when we used it on our yard! I highly recommend this brand and tool due to its easy is assembly, use, and convenience with it being battery powered and working with. All the other green works tools
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Zentz

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Greenworks Tools
customer_reviews.text: Takes a learning curve for the articulating. Mine, also, came with a miss wound spool. So I manually pulled out more string. I’ll see how the new rolls work or wind my own. Have a medium size city lot with driveway. I’m guessing a good edging has never been done on this yard. Used a B & D edger last year and didn’t complete the job. Too much work. This Greenworks solved the issue, especially on the city curb. Have GW 60v mower, 40v turbo blower and now this edger trimmer. Will buy the snow shovel too.
customer_reviews.author: DRYBOULDER

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions not clear
customer_reviews.text: We made mistake in assembling the lower and upper shaft. No instructions on how to disengage. On phone with Greenworks for over an hour on hold. Then tried to go online for help. Had to join some kind of membership for $5 trial. Still got no help. Can't tell you if it works or not since we can't get the answer we need. Need to add to this. After much effort we were able to reassemble the shift. All is well. However still not happy with the support we received from Greenworks and the idea we had to pay for advice.
customer_reviews.author: Frannie

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong Weed Whacker
customer_reviews.text: My push behind weed whacker broke in a couple of places. While it was in the shop, I purchased this electric weed whacker. Considering I was using a heavy duty craftsman before, I was skeptical this small whacker would keep up. I was pleasantly surprised. It took out all those heavy duty weeds and grass like they weren't there. The automatic feeder works amazing. It was lightweight to use. Love it! I was afraid with all the catching up I had to do, the poor thing would break. It didn't, but if it had, I would have purchased a new one without hesitation because I did beat it to death. You won't be sorry buying this weed whacker!
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend the 40v product except for extremely light duty.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really recommend the 40v product. The line is thin and flimsy and is only adequate for cutting the most delicate plants. On anything even vaguely tough it will bounce off (if you're lucky) or (generally) snap immediately. Aside from that the build of the trimmer is decent, but, what does that actually matter? I should have bit the bullet and bought the EGO, which is great for whacking small woody plants as well as sturdy weeds. It costs considerably more but on the other hand it works. Oh well, lesson learned. Maybe I will try some stranded wire (and wear some very tough pants and/or shin guards).
customer_reviews.author: joe_n_bloe

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine for me, pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Read previous reviews on this some good some not. Well it works great for me and just remember not your gas powered weed eater. The strong feed on it some complained but works just fine. Read the instructions on this it states to feed line must stop and start Wdeater. I release power for it completely stop rotating and restart. I may does this one to few time and feed out 1 to 2 inch line at a time to get my four inches or better of line.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have a GreenWorks lawnmower and love it so thought that I would add to my collection with this cordless string trimmer. This is really a poor product. The auto advance of the string simply does not work. I have to stop every 20-30 seconds, remove the battery, manually advance the string, reinsert the battery and then repeat the process. I have given up on it and returned to my corded string trimmer. I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you have time and a baby lawn.
customer_reviews.text: The 1/4 inch feed on the trim line is ridiculous! Say you need 6" of line; do the math. If you are trimming around objects which can break line most of your time is spent getting the line to feed. I have a lawn and other areas to trim. The battery life lasts me about 25 minutes. The cost for additional batteries to complete the job make this a poor choice for me. the light weight is nice as is the quiet. Have used this maybe twice and it now sits in the shop as too tedious and limited in its use. Very disappointed that I missed deadline to return. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: C Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: This weed eater doesn’t work well. The string popped after one use. I read this information in other reviews, but I decided that it was a great value and worth chancing. However, I learned that the string really is going to pop. It was very lightweight and easy to use. Unfortunately, the string pops after use and once I put it back on track, it did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. J.

customer_reviews.title: Plug constantly getting pulled out and shutting it off
customer_reviews.text: I could not dislike this any more. This is an electric version, and the plug is right at the top of the handle. You can keep your chord nice and loose, and try to do your weed whacking ... and it will snap off about once every 2-3 minutes. Honestly my blood pressure probably still hasn’t recovered from how frustrated I was by this. I don’t know if this is all weed eaters that are electronic, or if this design is just poor. I have a feeling it’s a classic case of getting what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: MyBunnyGoBoom

customer_reviews.title: Great green trimmer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trimmer and took it for a test run the day it arrived, Assembly was straight forward. Charged the battery completely and was able to complete all my trimming and edging and then some. Left with 1 bar of battery life. THe charger is fairly quick. So far I am very pleased with the results and fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: jamaica007

customer_reviews.title: This product will not hold up to normal wear.  Company will not stand by their products as well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in April and by mid June the deflector guard and the spool cover had both broken after minimal use. This was just outside the Amazon return window. I called the Greenworks support line and they would not replace the items or refund. The replacement parts were more expensive than the entire unit. I have purchased a leaf blower, pole saw, and hedge trimmer from Green Works as well but would not recommend the weed trimmer or the company as a whole
customer_reviews.author: C P

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this trimmer because I already had a Greenworks battery and charger, and didn't need another battery. Overall I am moderately satisfied with it. It is powerful and rips through fairly tall grass easily. I do find it heavier than expected. With string cartridge and battery attached, it actually is almost 12 lbs. Also, I find it difficult to use the edging feature effectively. Battery life appears quite satisfactory so far. The balance is good. The machine is a bit noisier than my last trimmer. I'm 5'7" tall, and a shorter person might find it uncomfortable to use for any extended period.
customer_reviews.author: xplorer

customer_reviews.title: Very good until the second use
customer_reviews.text: Survived doing an over grown logging trail no complaints. I wish the string was stronger but that goes for all weed wackers one day I may try piano wire! Good battery life and good at tough weeds and plants. Update Crushing experience went to use it for time number two it tried to start then failed instantly wasn’t the battery as I mowed the lawn instead. Went to customer support for green works and that failed as well I got error messages when trying to submit a support ticket. I’m assuming it’s bound up with grass on the inside but either way not super happy it lasted one time.
customer_reviews.author: JJC

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed with this, but it's somewhat my fault. I didn't realize it only had one trimmer line extended from the spool. Stupid me, I thought all trimmers had 2 (or more). I was looking for a 2 line replacement spool that I could maybe adapt to this model, but couldn't find any that stated it would fit. I hate to waste more money on something that may not work. This cuts slow and a little rough. Anyway, my mistake, but I would never buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mahlen Petry

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a workhorse. I spent 4 hours outside working in my yard. 3 of those 4 hours were spent using this thing! I was impressed. My only complaint is that the handle won't stop moving around mid use! I'm sure if I could get it on there tighter, it wouldn't be an issue. I, however, can't seem to get it any tighter. I I appreciate that this came with an extra thing of string and an extra cap. The cap broke off of my last one and I couldn't find a replacement anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: A great, lightweight weed eater!
customer_reviews.text: My wife are in our late 60"s and we are huge Greenworks fans and have been for several years. We have more than Greenworks tools. This weed eater was just what we needed. I opened the box at 2:30 and by 3:10 I was trimming weeds and I am not handy. I trimmed for nearly an hour on the same small battery. We had a larger model and gave it to our son-in-law because it was just getting too heavy for us. This has very balanced weight and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cattleman's

customer_reviews.title: Works well and shares the same battery as their lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased that I can use the same battery that I use in my lawnmower and saved money by ordering without the battery and charger. With the battery attached, it isn't really lightweight. It can be adjusted to operate in several useful positions. The automatic line release doesn't always work and sometimes I have to stop and pull it out by hand. However, it's better to be a bit on the stingy side and not waste extra line.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Down

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this now for two years and it has never once self fed the line out itself. Every time that a line snaps off, I have to open it and feed it out of the holes again. In my forty plus years of doing yard work, I have never owned such a piece of junk in the yard. I spend more time using this than mowing the entire yard and using the blower together!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael T Boyd

customer_reviews.title: NOT Good!
customer_reviews.text: Used only about four times in two years. Kept safely but on the fourth time it just blew with smoke and all! 😲😟 What made things worse was having to go to Greenworks for honoring their four year warranty. Their only option is to give replacements, not refunds, which is all I wanted and needed at this point. Ridiculously, my correspondent there repeatedly kept asking me for information Amazon and I had given them in my first application form!!! Their customer service is awful. Be warned about product quality AND poor warranty. I gave up, and wonderful Amazon made good and refunded my price in full.
customer_reviews.author: Gem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Light Weight Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent light weight trimmer. I recently had open heart surgery and needed a light trimmer for the yard. This worked perfectly. I had not problem with feeding the line. As long as you realize that every time you stop the trimmer (release the trigger), you will hear a "click" which tells you that the line is feeding. If you stop the trimmer a lot you will go through a lot of line. This went through pretty thick and damp grass with no troubles.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzybrain

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer. You will need to buy your own line.
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer works great! Love the fact it uses the same batteries as the other equipment! I finally have changed most of my equipment over to GreenWorks so I can use the same batteries. I would have given this item a 5 start, unfortunately ...the trimming line they give you is junk! And it's taken me a few uses to realize what's actually giving me troubles. The blue line literally heats up and melts to the line it's spooled around. One of my line spools ended up a hunk of melted blue line. My suggestion... keep the trimmer and black spools... and throw their blue line away; then rewind with a thicker, heavier line.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Nichols Quinn

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! Well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Well designed, efficient packaging, easy assembly, and self explanatory! Battery life is more than sufficient for my needs. Weed eating and edging are easy! I purchased extra weed line but am still on the original spool. Came with a second spool and cap. Compatible with other Greenworks 40v tools. 2 batteries gets my mowing, weed eating / edging, and blower yard work done. I could not be more pleased with this birthday purchase to myself 😎
customer_reviews.author: coon78

customer_reviews.title: Look for the newest model
customer_reviews.text: The line feed is of poor design and does not work properly. Other than that, this is like my Green Works chainsaw. I wouldn’t sell or trade that for anything else. The simplicity of design, light weight and reliability is incredible. They should just make a replacement for the string head. I string mine with about fifteen feet of .80 line now and works better but still disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery setup
customer_reviews.text: The edger is an okay product. It's the battery that makes me wish I would have bought a different brand. The battery release clip is designed for dainty little hands. The release is especially hard to release after a few months of use. It is also hard to release after you've been working hard in the yard and your hands are sweaty. You almost need to go ask your wife, "Honey, can you release the battery from the edger, please?"
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Nice trimmer
customer_reviews.text: So I was a little worried about buying this trimmer due to the bad reviews about the automatic line feed. But it does work, it’s just a little different than I’m used to. You have to let the motor stop completely and you’ll hear a low click. That’s the line feeding out. If you trigger it a few times and let the motor stop completely, you’ll get the line to feed out plenty. I bought this to go with a mower that didn’t come with a battery (it was way cheaper) because they use the same battery and charger. It worked out great :)
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks needs to make some improvements on this yet
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is the string feed doesn't work very well. Whenever the string gets too short, I have to stop, dis-assemble the string mechanism, and manually feed more string thru. The unit is also heavier than my old Black & Decker cordless. The plus's include - great battery life, and good power to cut thru the thickest grass. And if you fiddle with it, there is a setup where it can be used as an edge trimmer, which I have now used several times along my driveway - again it has more than enough power to be effective as an edge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hermiller

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as a trimmer or edger!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this inadequate trimmer and forget using as a hedger. String does not come out properly and requires a constant stop and start trigger pull. Also the string snaps back into the spool constantly requiring you to take the head off and spool it through the feeder hole. String stinks, and breaks constantly. Worst purchase ever made. Be ashamed be very ashamed for even selling this.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Cutting it down for you: the pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: low price, lightweight, strong for electric trimmer, head turns for edging, adjustable telescopic pole to accomodate user height (very limited), you can string it yourself Cons: feeder spool seems to get locked up often requiring adjustment, the telescopic pole only pulls out so far- I'm 5'11" and I find myself hunching over to reach the ground. Overall, I feel that this is a Good value for the price. If I can get 2 seasons of work out of this weedeater then I'll be satisied.
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Great product wow the power
customer_reviews.text: Great product this is my first electric trimmer i have 3 gas trimmers that are two powerful and heavy for my mother to use because ill get to it once im done with this project dont work for her and she goes and starts it herself this one i opened the box looked at it figured out there is only one screw to put the guard on and was running it in two minutes after opening it its light enough for her to wield and quieter then my big gas trimmers we ran it for about 45 minutes straight without issue by then i was out of things to find to trim
customer_reviews.author: Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: definitely not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it wasn't completley "assembled" when I received it and the instructions were really unhelpful. the grass deflector would not "sit " and the screw was almost not long enough. The thing is HEAVY. Holding the power button on is difficult. I could not figure out how to get the "front handle" on. It wasn't going on the way I thought it should and again-no instructions. NOT HAPPY...but I guess I am stuck with it. And it's LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Marie

customer_reviews.title: Auto-feed system does not work
customer_reviews.text: Auto-feed system for the line does not work most of the time. You have to stop every few minutes to take the spool out and manually pull out more line, it makes this thing pain even to do a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: The price you cannot beat the price when you need one this one does the job and your done no battery to worry about great for that quick little job that needs to be done every so often I could not be happier for the price I paid and for the little area I use it for. Being left handed causes me a problem I have to wear socks or grass gets all over my pant legs but what choice do I have really it's a right handed world.
customer_reviews.author: product2review

customer_reviews.title: avsolute piece of s---
customer_reviews.text: both top and bottom shafts do not and will not line up in a straight line. also, the trimmer head is absolute junk,. you must trim smooth grass only, and the cutter line is very light weight, will not stand up to cutting weed stems, any you must CONSTANTLY keep trying to extend the trimmer line so that it will cut grass. i mean this is a kinder garden toy. bill perreault
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I opened up the box right after delivery. Assembly was pretty logical, and the instructions provided are helpful. Once it was put together, I loaded the battery and it worked perfectly. The shield blocked any stray grass/weeds/rocks from hitting me, which is definitely a nice feature. One tip, if you're buying multiples in the G-max series, make sure you have 2 batteries so you don't run out of power before the task is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable and well constructed;easy to handle!
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this edger/trimmer. Never had done my own yardwork in the area of lawn maintenance but finally gave up on awful lawn service...and as a 75 year old widow bought a mower and this trimmer and now do it myself. Love this! Does an excellent job, good battery life...easy to maneuver! Love the mower from the same manufacter. Lived up to the description 100%. Enjoy managing my own lawns so much and good dependable products make the work so easy!
customer_reviews.author: A. L.Willard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved into a small property. I didn't need much to trim the small yard but still needed something. I went with a cheap electric corded trimmer but have been surprised how well this thing works. I've had a lot of trimmers, gas-powered and battery-powered and this works as well if not better than any of them. The cutting string extends itself automatically without any hangups so far. I've been very pleased with this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: James Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of spending so little on a tool but this trimmer delivers. It handles the edges of my, fairly thick, grass just fine; even when its very long. The auto advance feature works fairly well and replacing the string is easy (though it lasts a good while). Again, didn't think such a cheap tool would be "buy-it-for-life" but I can't see anything taking this down as long as I keep using it for light yard-work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arenson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent.  A bit weak - mostly due to the single-string head - would be better double-string
customer_reviews.text: The benefit is - its pretty lightweight and appears to be pretty well made. The price is very good. The battery works great & lasts quite a while. The handle and such is comfortable to use. The not so great part is - the single-string trimmer part. It really needs to be a two-string trimmer. It is just a bit weak, but does normal grass trimming. Larger stuff requires you to hold the trimmer in place until it clears out the spot. On the plus side, you can use it right up against an above-ground pool and you won't damage it.
customer_reviews.author: ForrestA

customer_reviews.title: Got smoke after 3times of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trimmer used just 3 times and the 3rd time I saw smoke coming out of it. Ordered for the replacement and the changing of spool is tricky as well. If you consider the weight it’s perfect very easy to hold. So If you decide to buy this trimmer, I highly recommend not using it for more than 5 -10 minutes at a time without breaks to let the motor cool.* That seems to be about all the fuse can handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ape

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the trimmer, but the fact that the string keeps breaking and getting hung up on the reel makes it tiresome to use. Read other reviews about rewinding reel or things getting better with second reel of string but that was not my experience. It's too bad, too, because all other aspects of the trimmer are nice. It would have been better if there had been an automatic string feeding feature. too. Cannot recommend this because they need to get it together with the string reel
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT DOES NOT COME ASSEMBLED
customer_reviews.text: The description is TOTALLY MISLEADING. Assembly instructions NOT included in package I went on Amazon to find it and not acceptable.. I tried to look at the spool and when I pulled the cover off it all fell out.. String is tangled from the get go. The screw INSTRUCTIONS NOT CLEAR AT ALL how to attach the guard. You have to be a mechanic to put this together...... And last but not least, called the manufacturer and they are closed. Today is a Friday4pm and they say they are closed when hours say till 5.. POOR Product, no customer service
customer_reviews.author: John, FLL

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weedwacker for a very small yard (maybe 50’ x 20’), so I knowingly opted for a cheap solution. The setup out of the box was incredibly easy and I was impressed with the quality and sturdiness of manufacturing. When I started using the tool I was immediately impressed with its power! I’ve used gas powered weedwackers before and this one easily keeps up with them for a fraction of the price. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: mattyk

customer_reviews.title: Great edger for people 5 feet tall.
customer_reviews.text: The head works well the trigger handle is a little sketchy since it will not except a 12/3 Extension cord in the cord retainer mechanism. The major problem is the shaft length too short for me I’m 6 feet tall my waist is approximately 36 inches off the ground. according to the directions I should be operating the trigger at hip hight which means grip handle is about 24 inches off the ground in edging mode which works if you’re under 4’ 6” tall
customer_reviews.author: soundmiami

customer_reviews.title: If you have thick weeds or wire feed this thing is terrible because of auto feed
customer_reviews.text: I have wire fence that i have weed eat around and very thick weeds. This means the line cuts often. In order to advance the line you have to take your finger off the trigger wait a few seconds for it to stop and then start up again.. It only releases a very small amount of line each time.. So every 30 seconds I have to stop what I'm doing and sit there and start and stop this thing 15 times to get enough line out. It's really awful if you have a lot of string cuts.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth the hassle. The auto string feeder is AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: We loved the idea of a battery operated weed whacker. But I have to agree with those who had concerns about the automatic string feeder. IT'S ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. I wish it was a manual loading string feeder. If this was manually loading it'd be very good. But this automatic feeder DOES NOT WORK. I will be returning this. It's a good concept but DOES NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: TH Houtman

customer_reviews.title: Most homeowners don't need more than this
customer_reviews.text: I realize that the marketing says bigger and more are better. But, come on, seriously? We're trimming grass and the occasional pesky out-of-control vine. This trimmer is light, has a decent cut diameter, and works really well in the edger mode. And, it's easy to replace the line when you need to. Done. And I know everybody wants the "convenience" of cordless, but I'm old-school when it comes to power source. I have tried battery units before and they all poop out before I am finished with what I need it for. Thta's never convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Deja Rev

customer_reviews.title: Charger Quit 10 Seconds After Plugging It In
customer_reviews.text: Reviews were why I bought this Greenworks model. Plugged in the the charger to have the battery charged for the next day. The charge light went out within 10 seconds. Still thought I'd let it charge. Nothing, the charger was not working. Went to Amazon to have it exchanged. They suggested because of the problem to contact Greenworks. I did ask to be contacted through email. Tried 4 times and could not submit my concern. So my only solution is to request a refund, no, not a replacement because of a lack of customer service from Green works.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Line won't advance
customer_reviews.text: I have to take the stupid thing apart every time to advance the line. Once the line gets loose and your rethread it, it just gets tangled on the spool and won't advance. I'm disgusted. I do like that it's much lighter than my previous one. I'm 72 and need light gardening tools.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Faulty batteries
customer_reviews.text: I liked it at first but after a couple uses the battery would not charge completely so I researched as to why this would happen and it said a faulty battery and I only had it for like a month are you kidding me? I reached out to Green works on their website to see if I could get a replacement battery and have not heard back from anybody this is bad business save your money and just go buy one from Lowe's or home Depot
customer_reviews.author: soccerkid117

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 uses 😒
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in January and didn't start using it till march. I tried to use it recently and it started smoking. I stopped immediately to inspect it and found no obstructions or any obvious damage. When I tried to use it again it was completely dead. Even though I only used it a few times, I can't return it because too much time has passed. I contacted Greenworks and I received a vague reply of, we'll get back to you but it may take awhile because of Covid-19. Meanwhile my HOA is citing me and threatening to fine me for not having my lawn edged properly. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Gitsmeok

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing in most categories
customer_reviews.text: Auto feed doesn’t work. String isn’t tangled. It just doesn’t feed. Have to manually uncoil it every time. Mine doesn’t have the button to push that some people talk about that allows you to extend the wire easily. Side edging w wheels doesn’t work well, either. It spins and makes a wide cutting path, causing it to wear very quickly on the sidewalk edge. My cheap Black and Decker was better than this thing. I have an edger, blower/muncher, extension hedge trimmer but this is the worst Off to Kohl’s to return it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great little weed whacker.
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a 40 year old woman who hasn't really done yard work before. But, with my hubby working long hours away from home, I decided to dig in and get it done. Here are some thoughts: Pros: Very light weight, strong motor, easy to use & assemble. Has made the yard work super simple. Cons: The "cord helper" that is built into the handle isn't wide enough to accomodate the heavy-duty extension cord I use outdoors. So I have to do a wrap/tie to help it not unplug. Every 5 mins or so, I have to make sure the plug is firmly in place. Would absolutely recommend and would buy again if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hearthside

customer_reviews.title: ... stars since the string that comes with it is terrible. Breaks continually and makes the the trimmer essentially ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the trimmer itself however 3 stars since the string that comes with it is terrible. Breaks continually and makes the the trimmer essentially worthless. I had bought the recommended GreenWorks replacement trimmer string as well and found it had the same problems as what came with the trimmer. Went back and read another review where it was talking about using RINO-TUFF 0.065" Trimmer Line so ordered that and rewound all my spools with it. Everything worked perfectly after that. Bottom line is the trimmer itself is good however save yourself a lot of time and trouble by getting an alternative trimmer line to use BEFORE you get frustrated with this product.
customer_reviews.author: pharman65

customer_reviews.title: Best value on the market.  Works as described. 👍
customer_reviews.text: Best $50 I've spent. This weed eater is darn neer perfect. I don't know what's up with the bad reviews. I read the instructions and had it running in 10 minutes. Feels very sturdy and more powerful than my old cordless weed eater. I also love my 19 inch greenworks mower. So convenient that the batteries work for both tools. I can get my yard mowed and trimmed with the 4 ah and 2 ah batteries that I have. Looking forward to adding more greenworks tools to my collection. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and works like a charm. Manual directions could have been better though.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and works like a charm. Easy to assemble and use but manual directions could have been better though. Sometimes a naive can keep scratching his head to figure out parts.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Singh

customer_reviews.title: Use with 4 amp battery for best balance.
customer_reviews.text: This little guy pretty much zipped almost Straight Out of the Box. The one thing that's a little funny is the weight balance. The design seems to be best weighted for the 4 amp battery. The 2 amp battery is too light and the balance is to the front. The cord that came with it seems pretty sturdy, it was able to do my fence line and some rock edges and only broke once.
customer_reviews.author: Y Light

customer_reviews.title: GET the best battery you can afford
customer_reviews.text: I bought Greenworks' lawn mower & pole saw. The lawn mower came with a charger & a 6.0AH battery, and I bought a 2nd battery (not cheap). With the 6.0AH battery, this keeps running for 3-4 straight hours. The instruction could be written more concisely, as I didn't know I could pull out the string by clicking on the black button while keeping tension on the string (do this with the battery REMOVED of course). Other than that, it does what it's designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: JPN850R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect :)
customer_reviews.text: Greenworks 13-Inch 4 Amp Electric Corded String Trimmer 21212 I read all the reviews before buying..........Sooooooooo glad I got this , perfect for me . No batteries to charge or, charger to go bad ( Done with those ) . Assembly was easy and went to work . Did a beautiful job :) . Just follow the instructions and you will be good to go :). Awesome for the price . I am happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: No more bump feed problems, auto feed is great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for two seasons and it is one of the best string trimmers of this type I have ever owned. I have owned other electric and gas trimmers and although it's not as powerful as a gas model it's by no means a wimp at cutting grass and normal weeds. The self feed mechanism eliminates my one gripe about the bump trimmer. It has always worked perfect. This will probably not work for an acre or more lot unless you are really patient but for normal and small size yards this will work great. One spool lasted me for one season and they included a second spool in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works well and as advertised. The ability to rotate the head between more-traditional trimmer and edger has been useful. The string auto feeds about 1/4" each time the trimmer is started which hasn't always been sufficient - I find myself having to cycle through a couple start/stops to get enough line out. I'm 6'4" and find the trimmer isn't quite long enough for me and I have to stoop quite a bit to use it - but that's not the fault of the trimmer. I works well for my small 1,000 square foot lawn.
customer_reviews.author: M.Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Uses interchangable battery with my mower.
customer_reviews.text: The assembled trimmer with the battery weighs more than I expected, not really a fault, but I'm an older woman, and hoped that it would be lighter. However, it works well as I don't have a lot of trimming to do. It tackled even the larger weeds with flying colors. I didn't have to purchase another battery as I already have one for my mower. Great that the battery can be used in other Greenworks items. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hammel

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Monday and in the trash Tuesday
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on Monday and in the trash Tuesday! Now the reason why I got this one is because my backyard is so small and yet this thing died before I could even get done is absolutely ridiculous. Yes, I could send it back but it’s not even worth the money for me to drive to a drop off location. So annoyed... should have just gone to Lowe’s
customer_reviews.author: Perfectlypinkpsychiatrist

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a pain in the butt....from taking off the bottom cap to loading the new line......the line melts onto itself so it wont release new line....If you can tolerate the major hassle of opening, loading and poor line releasing.....it works ok. But the hassle is not worth it. Worst purchase ever...dont buy this......its crap.
customer_reviews.author: lappuppies

customer_reviews.title: Cordless String trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased other Greenworks products. This one was not of the same quality as other products. Not only does it not work very well, it is very heavy when you insert the battery. Would rather deal with a corded trimmer than this inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Bvette

customer_reviews.title: The guard fell off of mine on first use repeatedly!!! :-( May want to invest in something nicer.
customer_reviews.text: Well the fiilrst time I used this I loved it. I thought it worked amazing. I took a break for a bit and went back to weed whacking my yard and the guard kept popping off. I had to put it back on like 500 times while working on my back yard. It got to be so redundant that I ended up just leaving the guard off (not safe I know, but I cannot realistically keep grabbing it when it falls off and putting it back on). I would have loved to give 5 stars and love this product, however, the guard coming off has caused me to despise it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda2119

customer_reviews.title: filament feeding failure leads to overcooked electric motor
customer_reviews.text: The Greenworks 13 in. 4 A. corded string trimmer has a strong enough motor that works well. However, its automatic feeding of filament started to fail during the second time that I used it in early April of 2018. I continued to use it once a week and manually paid out the filament until the end of July 2018 when it failed catastrophically by automatically feeding the complete contents of the doubly wound spool of filament and burning its electric motor in about 1 second. Save money and time, and avoid nuisance and irritation by buying weed eaters made by other manufacturers. Eschew Greenworks weed eaters.
customer_reviews.author: disappointed

customer_reviews.title: easy to use electric trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Although I would've preferred a gas model trimmer, I bought this for my parents who wanted a simple, easy to use electric trimmer. Set up was quick and easy and my dad had no problems using it. Update 8/12/18 I should have gone with my gut and stuck with a gas powered trimmer last year. This product didn’t last as it wouldn’t power on this morning. Without factoring in the winter months, it saw limited use as my dad only used it to trim a 5x8 section of grass in their backyard about once a month.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.A-NYC

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! This thing broke down after three uses. I have the lawnmower, leaf blower, and hedge trimmer which I love from green works but this is horrible. It is heavy and bulky, extremely loud (I had to apologize to my neighbors for disrupting their Sunday afternoon). The third time I used it all the shaking caused all the screws to come loose and the thing fell apart after an hour
customer_reviews.author: F. Boucher

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to the GreenWorks lineup!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third GreenWorks tool (after a snow-blower and a leaf-blower). It uses the same battery as my leaf blower, which is really handy since I already had one and could buy the "tool only". The battery lasts long enough for me to do all the trimming in my yard and then switch to the leaf blower and blow the clippings into my lawn. Assembly didn't even take ten minutes. My last trimmer was a Black & Decker corded electric. This one seems a little more powerful, but is a LOT more convenient. I am certain my neighbors will be happy I purchased this one, since I will definitely use it more consistently because of the added convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Green Eric

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little trimmer. Has a lot more power than I expected. The auto-feed is quite handy. Unit is lightweight and the directions are pretty straight-forward. So far, no problems at all. My only design comments: 1. Debris guard could be a little wider and deeper. 2. Wire spacer does nothing. I always have it folded up and out of the way 3. The loop handle doesn't fit tight enough. It tends to rotate around the handle too freely 4. Distance from the cutter to the grip is a bit short. Maybe 6" longer would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

product_meta.title: Greenworks 13-Inch 40V Cordless String Trimmer/Edger, 2.0 AH Battery Included 21302
product_meta.description: Size:2Ah Battery and Charger| Style:40VGreenworks GMAX 40-Volt 2 Amp Hour 13 Inch String Trimmer, Includes Battery and Charger, Model #21302.
feature_bullets: Gas free cordless design eliminates the gas hassle while getting the job done
Lighter, reliable, easy push button start will not wear your arms out. No-load speed (RPM): 0 - 9,000
Pivoting head allows for edging and trimming capability with edging wheel
Compatible GreenWorks Replacement Spool, Model 29252 and 29092
Battery and Charger included (Model 29462). Compatible with battery model 29472 and charger 29482.Drive Shaft Type: Telescoping

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars556 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
